required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Compare Intravenous and Oral Hydration of the Prevention for CIN in Elderly Patients Undergoing Intravenous CECT
clinical_study.official_title: To Compare Intravenous and Oral Hydration of the Prevention for Contrast-induced Nephropathy in Elderly Patients Undergoing Intravenous Contrast-enhanced Computed Tomographyï¼š A Multi-center Randomized Control Trail

brief_summary.textblock: To Compare Intravenous and Oral Hydration of the Prevention for Contrast-induced Nephropathy in Elderly Patients Undergoing Intravenous Contrast-enhanced Computed Tomography.

detailed_description.textblock: The prospective multicenter randomized controlled clinical research discusses the comparison of oral and intravenous hydration for prevention of contrast-induced nephropathy in elderly patients with enhanced computed tomography, establishing a simple hydration proposal.

primary_outcome.description: Compared with before examination, the increase of serum creatinine conforms to the diagnostic criteria of contrast induced nephropathy.

arm_group.description: Oral distilled water at the rate of 3 mL/kg/h rate during undergoing enhanced computed tomography examination before 1-2 and after 4-6 hours
intravenous saline hydration at the rate of 1 mL/kg/h rate during undergoing enhanced computed tomography examination before and after 12 hours
